docs.snippet: Despite plenty of celebrities in attendance, the star of the party was its host, Mayor Antonio R. Villaraigosa of Los Angeles....
docs.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES- After arriving here late Wednesday night, the Bagger made it out to a few of the vaunted Oscar week parties on Thursday night. In local parlance the events are known as 'a thing' - as in, are you going to the Tom Ford thing? The Ed Ruscha thing? The IFC thing? The Soho House thing(s)? And as with any party circuit, a majority of the evening's conversations revolve around which thing you're going to after the thing that you're at, because clearly, there's always got to be a better thing.
docs.abstract: Despite plenty of celebrities in attendance, the star of the party was its host, Mayor Antonio R. Villaraigosa of Los Angeles.

headline.main: The Mayor Steals the Show at Oscar-Week Party

docs.snippet: Wendy Williams, the outspoken radio star-turned-TV talk show host, explains her choices for this Sunday's Oscars....
docs.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES- How you doin'? As part of our continuing celebrity Oscar ballot coverage, the Bagger spoke with Wendy Williams, the outspoken radio star-turned-TV talk show host. In addition to "The Wendy Williams Show," which is broadcast every weekday, Ms. Williams will next host the game show "Love Triangle," in which she will help real-life daters sort out their romantic entanglements. It will have its premiere in April on GSN, the game show network.
docs.abstract: Wendy Williams, the outspoken radio star-turned-TV talk show host, explains her choices for this Sunday's Oscars.

headline.main: Oscar Picks, Courtesy of Wendy Williams

docs.snippet: On the big night, visit oscars.nytimes.com/dashboard on your iPad, laptop, mobile phone or device of your choosing for wall-to-wall coverage....
docs.lead_paragraph: The brave new world of two-screen Oscar watching is upon us, and it's spreading. On the big night, visit oscars.nytimes.com/dashboard on your iPad, laptop, mobile phone or device of your choosing for wall-to-wall coverage, starting with live photos and interviews from the red carpet at 5 p.m. ET, tweets from the styles editor Stuart Emmrich (@StuartEmmrichNY), followed by live video analysis by our fashion experts, Eric Wilson and Simone Oliver.
